content:
Diagnosis:
T3N1M0 squamous cell carcinoma of right floor of mouth
Diagnosed March 2024

Previous treatment:
Induction TPF chemotherapy completed 15 April 2024
Concurrent cisplatin-radiotherapy commenced 1 May 2024

Current medications:
Ondansetron 8mg bd
Dexamethasone 4mg bd
Morphine sulfate modified release 30mg bd
Artificial saliva spray prn

Current situation:
Week 4 of concurrent chemoradiotherapy

I reviewed [redacted name] today during week 4 of concurrent chemoradiotherapy. He has completed 2 cycles of concurrent cisplatin with acceptable renal function. Grade 2 mucositis is present requiring increased analgesia and nutritional supplements. Weight has dropped by 4kg to 72kg but remains above trigger for feeding tube insertion. Some improvement in right-sided oral pain noted following recent analgesia adjustment.

Examination shows expected radiation-induced changes to right floor of mouth and neck. No evidence of disease progression. Performance status remains 1.

Plan is to proceed with cycle 3 cisplatin next week pending blood results. Will continue daily radiotherapy. Dietitian review arranged for additional nutritional support. Follow-up in radiotherapy review clinic next week.
